title: SoC PERF_ST 330-0-23 Topics in Performance Studies

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: The course will explore the nature and scope of black popular music across the African diaspora. We will reflect on what is "black" and what is "popular" about this broad and varied expression, and consider the ways in which the music both represents for black life and is expropriated into mainstream society. The course will help uncover the role music plays in social activism and in critique of power structures. We will examine how this role problematizes its understanding as entertainment.
